attributes.action: Keep the National Media Museum open and free to the public
attributes.additional_details:
The National Media Museum is one of Bradford's leading tourist attractions, welcoming thousands of families every year. The museum, which chronicles the development of cinema and television as key 20th Century art forms offers a unique look at our recent cultural heritage and is an informative and enjoyable day out for adults and children alike.

Cuts in government funding are now placing the museum under huge financial strain and could potentially threaten it with closure.

We the undersigned call on the government to protect the museum's funding and ensure that this fantastic institution remains open and free for members of the public.
